resources.string: Trichotillomania affects both adults and children, though it often begins in childhood or adolescence. It is estimated to affect about 1–2% of the population
Trichotillomania is a mental health disorder characterized by the compulsive urge to pull out one’s hair, leading to noticeable hair loss.
Increasing awareness and understanding of trichotillomania can help reduce stigma and encourage individuals to seek help.
Username should have more than 3 characters
Password should have more than 4 characters
Welcome to Trichlog. Congratulations for taking first steps in this journey. We are here to raise awareness regarding trichotillomania and guide you
Our goal is to help you identify triggers and help you overcome the urges. If you are ready to start the journey please go On!
In order to proceed you need to have an account:
